seed_prompt: Diagram: internal page fills as leaves split. Story: each leaf split adds a separator to the root; root's slot directory grows over time. Show a sequence or timeline with 2–3 stages: one separator, then two, then three, with leaves underneath.
draft_prompt:
A three-panel technical diagram sequence arranged horizontally on a clean white background, illustrating the growth of a database index structure over time. A prominent title at the top reads 'Index Growth Mechanism: Leaf Splits Drive Root Directory Expansion'.

Panel 1 (Left, labeled 'STAGE 1: Initial State (1 Separator)'): At the top, a rectangular blue container labeled 'Root Node (Slot Directory)' holds a single gray block marked 'Sep 50'. Below it, thick connecting lines point to two larger green rectangular containers labeled 'Leaf Node A (Keys < 50)' and 'Leaf Node B (Keys >= 50)'. Leaf A is partially filled with small data blocks; Leaf B is almost full.

A large gray arrow points from Panel 1 to Panel 2.

Panel 2 (Middle, labeled 'STAGE 2: Leaf Fill & Split Action'): Leaf B is now completely packed with data blocks and has a jagged red outline and a burst icon labeled 'FULL! SPLIT IN PROGRESS'. An upward-curving bright orange arrow labeled 'Promote Separator (75)' emerges from the splitting Leaf B, carrying a new gray block marked 'Sep 75' towards the Root Node. The Root Node at the top is shown expanding horizontally to accommodate the new block, now showing two slots: 'Sep 50 | [Empty Slot]'. Below the splitting leaf, faint outlines indicate it dividing into two smaller leaves.

A large gray arrow points from Panel 2 to Panel 3.

Panel 3 (Right, labeled 'STAGE 3: Root Growth Result'): The Root Node at the top is wider and now contains two distinct gray separator blocks: 'Sep 50 | Sep 75'. Below it, three green Leaf Nodes are connected: 'Leaf A', 'Leaf B1 (50-74)', and 'Leaf B2 (>= 75)'. A new annotation points to the Root Node saying 'Directory grown by one slot'. The overall aesthetic is clean digital illustration with a blueprint feel.

draft_payload.story_purpose: The diagram visually explains the cause-and-effect mechanism of B-tree style index growth: demonstrating that when bottom-level data pages (leaves) become full and split, they force upward propagation that expands the top-level directory (root node).
key_elements: Three-stage horizontal timeline layout (Initial, Split Action, Result)
Distinct color-coding: Blue for Root/Directory, Green for Leaves/Data, Orange/Red for Action/Change
Visual representation of 'fullness' in leaf nodes (packed data blocks)
Explicit 'Split' action visualization (burst icon, jagged edges)
Upward mobility arrow showing the 'Promotion' of a new separator key
Visual widening of the Root Node container across the stages
labels_icons: Container Labels: Root Node (Slot Directory), Leaf Node
Action Icons/Labels: 'FULL! SPLIT IN PROGRESS' (burst icon), 'Promote Separator' (upward arrow), 'Directory grown by one slot'
draft_payload.style_notes: Clean, modern technical illustration style. Palette: Deep blues for structure, calming greens for data storage, bright orange/red for active changes and highlights. Line weights: Thick lines for major container outlines and flow arrows, medium lines for connectors, thin lines for internal data blocks. Typography: Clean, highly legible sans-serif font (e.g., Helvetica or Roboto); bold for titles and major labels, regular weight for internal data values.

visual_consistency.notes: Excellent consistency in color coding (blue root, green leaves, gray separators), layout (three horizontal panels with uniform titles and transitions), and typography. The 'action' elements in Stage 2 (red burst, orange arrow) are distinct but visually integrated.

pleasing.notes: Aesthetically pleasing with a clean, modern digital blueprint style. The color palette is professional, and the layout is well-spaced and uncluttered, making the technical information easy to digest.
